definition: section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: I should like to express my heartfelt gratitude for your gracious receptionhospitality.
sentences.chinese: 我愿向你们盛情的接待与款待表示衷心的感谢。

sentences.english: One such raid came while Evazan was hosting a dinner for the Andoan Senator.
sentences.chinese: 有一次袭击甚至发生在埃瓦赞款待那位安多议员时。

sentences.english: In 1960 Khruschev headed a delegation to visit Indonesia and was royally treated by his host.
sentences.chinese: 率团出访印度尼西亚，他受到了主人的盛情款待。

sentences.english: Permit me first of all to thank you, our host for your extraordinary arrangements and warm hospitality.
sentences.chinese: 首先，请允许我感谢主办方的精心安排和盛情款待。

sentences.english: She was hostess also to Clifford's occasional aristocratic relations.
sentences.chinese: 她也款待着克利福的不常来的贵族亲戚们。

sentences.english: I was hospitably entertained. Thank you!
I'm grateful for your hospitality and the hospitality of the people of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 我对在座的各位和埃及人民的热情款待万分感激。

sentences.english: The King'n Trio entertained attendees with their folk songs and Rotary-themed lyrics.
sentences.chinese: 三重唱用他们的民歌和扶轮主题的歌曲来款待与会者。

sentences.english: Folks in the southern UnitedStates, in particular, take pride in entertaining guests.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是美国的南方人更以款待客人而自豪。

sentences.english: But she acted with graciousness and hospitality.
sentences.chinese: 但是她表现得既有风度又热情的款待。

sentences.english: ChengJun hospitality will hold a press announced the buy benevolence, the attempt to establish really.
sentences.chinese: 成俊召开记者款待会，宣布了收买仁真建立的企图。

sentences.english: He treated his friends in his country cottage.
sentences.chinese: 他在他的乡间别墅款待了他的朋友们。

sentences.english: At Peking was the Great Khan, and they were hospitably entertained.
sentences.chinese: 忽必烈汗在北京，他们受到了盛情款待。

sentences.english: We were regaled with tea and cakes.
Tantalus, king of Lydia, once treated the gods to a banquet.
sentences.chinese: 里底亚国王丹达罗斯曾设宴款待天上诸神。

sentences.english: Chinese will pay the bill and check out generously. Occidental don't often entertain guests; but Chinese often invite friend to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 西方人不常款待客人，而中国人却经常邀请朋友吃饭。

definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
to act as host/to do the honors
hospitality/to treat guests well/to enjoy having guests/hospitable/friendly
